bibl.title: Photograph of the 2nd Division Hospital, 7th Army Corps, Camp Columbia, Havana, Cuba, April 1899

div1.p: Courtesy of the U.S. Army Medical Museum

div1.head: Photograph of the 2nd Division Hospital, 7th Army Corps, Camp Columbia, Havana, Cuba, April 1899
div1.p:
RUSSELL BROS ANNISTON ALA #339
2D DIV. HOSPITAL 7TH A.G.
CAMP COLUMBIA - HAVANA CUBA
APRIL 1899
MAJ IRA G. BROWN COMMANDING

IF PUBLISHED, PLEASE USE CREDIT LINE:
“U.S. AMRY MEDICAL MUSEM NEG.NO ____67355
ACC.NO.
Please return to
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn.
The bldg was most under in front than its depicted
Neg 4x5 - 997
Gen Kean (& Son) both agree that we are looking South
& that we are facing the “north” end of “Reeds bldg”
with the early aft shadow on the east side of the bldg
They agree that in this 1901 map the Reed lab axes
was esentially east & west not north & South as here Gen Kean says that with no basement it would
have been the easiest thing in the world to have
just moved this bldg or just turned it on its
axes, that they would have done this readily
rather than build a new one. See Truby p.92
which states the direction of the window unit a north light.
Truby agreed that this photo was taken probably during
the noon hour when men at lunch (hence have
Vanble)
9/6/43 Johny Moran doesn't recall Reed's lab looked like this
He slept in Reeds lab from Jan or Feb 1900 till about Nov 20
1901. Kissinger & he slept in the old surgery, Reeds lab
The rest occupied J. Neate who slept in the other end
& Reed worked there
